column1: share on facebook view photos (1)view video service info view anabelle t. anderson, 90. may 3, 1925 to june 1, 2015. anabelle t. anderson, 90, of princeton died at 7:45 p. m. monday, june 1, 2015, in princeton surrounded by a loving family. born may 3, 1925, in tiskilwa to oscar and margaret (rutherford) morris, she married kenneth o. anderson dec. 10, 1946, at fort sheridan, chicago. he died march 24, 2013. she graduated from tiskilwa high school in 1944. she was a homemaker. surviving are four daughters, karen (phil) mc. ardle of dwight, linda (terry) lanthrum of elburn, cheryl anderson of princeton and lori (scott) cook of normal; seven grandchildren, tim (wendy) goodrum of princeton, nathan lanthrum (dana fortunato) of st. charles, andrew (allison) lanthrum of st. charles, sarah (greg) johnson of metamora, kelsey larkey of princeton, jessica cook (michael nuding) of normal and kody cook of normal; three great-grandchildren, mason and ava goodrum of princeton, and greyson nuding of bloomington; one sister, lilly mae wiggim of princeton; two sisters-in-law, ruth (jim) henkel of park forest and annabel morris of princeton; and many nieces and nephews. she was preceded in death by her parents; husband; one brother, joseph o. morris; one sister, margaret e. morris. services will be at 1 p. m. thursday, june 4, at new hope church of the nazarene, princeton, with pastor laura tanner officiating. burial will be in oakland cemetery, princeton. visitation will be held prior to the services, from 11 a. m. to 1 p. m., at the church. pallbearers will be nathan lanthrum, andrew lanthrum, tim goodrum, kody cook, greg johnson and michael nuding. memorials may be directed to vitas hospice, 105 marquette st., suite a, la. salle, il 61301. service/memorial information. services will be at 1 p. m. thursday, june 4, at new hope church of the nazarene, princeton, with pastor laura tanner officiating. burial will be in oakland cemetery, princeton. visitation will be held prior to the services, from 11 a. m. to 1 p. m., at the church. pallbearers will be nathan lanthrum, andrew lanthrum, tim goodrum, kody cook, greg johnson and michael nuding. memorials may be directed to vitas hospice, 105 marquette st., suite a, la. salle, il 61301. anabelle's sign "our thoughts and prayers are with the entire family."tribute from: virginia wheeler, mary
